goals__remit:
Business and Cultural Development Centre (KEPA) is a nonprofit, private legal entity, based in Thessaloniki. It was founded in 1991 by the Federation of Industries of Northern Greece (FING) and Greek International Business Association (SEVE), for the implementation and management of Community and National programs or parts thereof for the benefit of private entrepreneurship. KEPA is run by a six-member Administrative Committee, with 3 members from each founding partner (FING, SEVE). 
Since 1993, the KEPA has been active as an Intermediate Body for the Implementation and Management of Programs of Pan - Hellenic and Inter-Regional scope, either autonomously or by participating in appropriate syndication schemes (eg EFEPE, ANEM, KEPA-ANEM). 
In particular, since 2001, the KEPA has been actively involved in the management of KEPA-ANEM, which has been responsible for the management of the programs of OP Competitiveness (3rd CSF III), EPAN II (NSRF 2007-2013) and EPAnEK (2014-2020), for the Regions of Central and Western Macedonia, as the key partner of the Intermediate Managing Authority (EFEPAE). 
Since its establishment, KEPA has implemented with absolute success, transparency and efficiency, 72 national/regional programmes assuming management responsibility for more than 16,000 investment projects, totaling €2,1 billion, with proportionate public financing disbursed €1.02 billion. 
These programmes —aiming to entrepreneurship and innovation support, with a particular focus on SMEs— concern the implementation of investments in the following sectors: Energy-Construction, Infrastructures, Manufacturing, Tourism, Environment, Trade, Training and Service Provision. In its role as programme manager, KEPA is responsible for all the actions related to the design, preparation, publication and dissemination of the calls for proposals, implementation and monitoring, selection of beneficiaries and disbursement of grants, follow-up and ex-post monitoring. KEPA possess a broad experience in:  
•    Designing and tailoring specific actions to co-finance development activities.  
•    Preparing sectoral/branch studies and doing research for the diagnosis of the developmental features and activities of businesses. 
•    Evaluating technical/economic and construction investment/business plans through the creation and use of suitable statistical and IT tools. 
•    Drafting technical/economic reports and proposals for enterprise developmental programmes. 
Moreover, KEPA possesses a thorough knowledge and a broad experience in EU projects (Interreg, COSME, Horizon 2020). Through its action at European level from 2011 onwards, KEPA has been a partner in 17 awarded projects (with a total budget of more than € 12 million), a fact that certifies the organization’s quality and its credibility as a partner.
relevant_communication:
DESIGN FOR INNOVATION 
During the last few years, KEPA has been actively working on the promotion of design-thinking in Greece. Partner in several EU projects, KEPA organizes numerous workshops and conferences with the participation of major European actors on Design. 
 
SEE Platform – Partner. SEE Platform is a network of 11 European partners engaging with national and regional governments to integrate design into innovation policies and innovation programmes. 
www.seeplatform.eu 
 
Design for Europe – Partner. Design for Europe is a three-year programme to support design-driven innovation across Europe. It is co-funded by the European Union as part of the EU’s Action Plan for Design-Driven Innovation. 
www.designforeurope.eu 
 
TERRITORIAL COOPERATION 
Lead Partner in the project '''Creating project pipeline for SME Development, financed by EU Structural Funds''(SME pipeline)'' in framework the European Territorial Cooperation Programme Greece-Bulgaria 2007-2013 
Partner in the project ''TRIGGER'' in framework the European Territorial Cooperation Programme Greece-Bulgaria 2007-2013 
 
MICRO-FINANCE 
KEPA is also actively working on the field of microfinance and social economy. Member of MFC (Microfinance Center), it is worth noting the project Microstars (Interreg Greece-Fyrom), whose aim is to "provide business development services or BDS in the cross-border area that will support micro-entrepreneurs and facilitate the establishment of start-ups". 
www.microstarsproject.eu 
 
EU NETWORKS 
KEPA is member of ERRIN (European Regions Research and Innovation Network), particularly involved in the following Working Groups: WG Design&Creativiy; WG Innovation&Investment; WG Smart Cities. KEPA has been co-organiser of EU Design Days in several occasions. 
www.eudesigndays.eu. 
 
Moreover, KEPA actively participates in the activities organised by EMN (European Microfinance Network), such as the First European Microfinance Day in October 2017, as well as in the events organised by fi-compass in both Brussels and Greece.
